phrases: Every once in a while, I remember that sword fight.
That day,
I lost my answer and simultaneously found it.
But not a single thing has changed.
In my fading memories, I see us.
He is still him, and I am still me.
It is not like I believed that
as a result of that fight, anything would change with us.
It is been two years since then.
I came face to face with my ideal.
I will not get my answer
for a long, long time yet.
Thanks for being so considerate again.
But I have told you a million times that I can do without breakfast.
I cannot have that.
You are allowing me to live here.
So it is the least I can do as your attendant.
You are still not a morning person.
That is surprising.
Having at least one little quirk like that
gives a girl some charm, right?
Schedule-wise,
I have a special lecture on cutting in mineralogy today.
How about you?
I think I just have primary subjects all morning.
Then we are together half the day.
Let us meet at our usual spot this afternoon.
Tohsaka...
No, forget it.
What is the matter?
Do you know that person?
No, we have just walked by each other a few times.
It was not that...
This is a bit belated, but it just hit me how strange this is.
Why is an outsider like me being allowed to study magic at a place like this?
For the last time, you are not an outsider.
I told you Clock Tower's rules, remember?
When you are a noted mage's rightful heir,
you are at constant risk of having others try to kill you.
Given that, a mage has the right
to be accompanied by a follower or pupil for their protection.
You are enrolled here as my follower,
so act a little more dignified.
I know that.
I am grateful to you, Tohsaka.
You ought to be.
Getting you in was not easy.
Well, it is only a three-year special exemption.
But be careful.
As a school, this place has rules,
but none of the normal social laws.
Even if it is just a minor ritual in the Far East,
you are a mage who survived the Holy Grail War.
You did that.
Some here will not take kindly to that,
so if you let down your guard...
Your guard is down.
Guess again!
Sherou!
Luvia-san?
Do not be so impersonal!
You are not currently on the clock as her butler, right?
Miss Luvia is perfectly fine, Sherou!
Do not get so chummy with him!
Oh, Miss Tohsaka...
We are classmates, as well as neighbors
living in the same apartment building.
What is so inappropriate about that?
Everything about it is inappropriate!
Relax, Tohsaka.
Let us try to get along with our classmates, okay?
Anyway, we only got the third floor of that building thanks to Luvia-san, right?
Sherou!
Hey!
Do not let it go to your head!
Oh, dear!
O-Oh, oh, oh, oh!
Change in plans!
Our next class will be...
Self-defense.
The class where one expresses one's vitality through physical ability.
The Edelfelt family's designated heir,
Luviagelita Edelfelt,
will do you the honor of schooling you.
Excellent!
You might be mistaken for a gorilla!
Miss Gorilla!
That is right, keep talking!
It hurts!
It hurts, it hurts!
What is the deal with that nouveau riche bitch?
I nailed her right in the medulla oblongata, so why would not she go down?!
Luvia-san is not a bad person, so just
Where did you two meet, anyway?!
Well, not long after we moved here, we both got lost...
Ow, ow, ow!
Ow!
Oh, well...
I will settle things with her eventually.
So, what will you do?
You got an invitation, right?
To officially join the Mages Association?
Yeah.
A mage's natural talents and the color of his soul are evaluated and recorded.
He then becomes a mage affiliated with Clock Tower.
Is not that a good thing?
Your activities would be limited in some ways
because you would basically be indebted to the Association.
But it comes with a lot of perks for a mage,
so most people would jump at it.
Yeah.
I guess you are right.
Becoming a Clock Tower member and a genuine mage...
It is the right decision.
But what I believed in was...
Tohsaka?
Sorry, I overslept.
I will start breakfast right now.
Emiya-kun...
Will you go somewhere with me today?
What is this place?
Glastonbury.
A certain king's grave.
That day,
you said you regretted not getting the chance to say a proper goodbye.
I will give you two some time alone.
I forgot that you were a king, Saber.
Thank you.
For what it is worth, I am here now, Saber.
This sure is a nice place.
Yeah, it is.
It feels weird to think that, in a place like this,
people once led lives nothing like ours.
Like they say, it is a big old world.
It is already been six months since we came to England.
For me, every day is one surprise after another.
How about you?
It is the same as you.
I have learned how insignificant I am.
I became a Master, fought with Saber,
and survived the Holy Grail War, right?
I boasted, I can do anything if I put my mind to it.
But by the very next day, that arrogance had faded away.
I am not surprised.
You never change, Shirou.
I understand now.
The Holy Grail War was a major event.
But when you see it from the outside like this,
it was only one event of many.
But there are things that were left behind.
And things that will change.
I might not have personally matured.
But I just saw for myself how special that battle was.
I am the opposite.
I am starting to believe it was not anything special at all.
The Holy Grail War, Clock Tower,
simple days like this...
They will never fundamentally change.
You borrowed Saber's strength,
but in her life, Saber herself relied on the strength of people of the past.
We are all connected.
I think we go through life using not only our own strength,
but also the hard work of those who came before.
Clock Tower is steeped in ancient traditions.
So every day, while I am studying, I feel like someone is judging me.
Like they are saying, What will you add to this?
Oh, I get it.
I guess that is only natural.
Hey!
Wake up, numbskull!
Everyone is already left for the assembly!
Are you boycotting it or something?
Hurry!
The closing assembly of our second year is about to start!
Issei...
How are things going on the mountain?
The rebuilding of the main hall just got underway.
Everyone is working hard.
Times such as these truly test a head priest's mettle.
Admittedly, I am barely even a novice...
But it is enough to make me want to bow in gratitude to our parishioners.
Yeah, I will come by to help out soon.
That reminds me, how is Shinji doing?
He is been in the hospital for quite some time.
Oh, do not worry.
He should be discharged any day now.
Sakura's been going to visit him daily.
Oh, his little sister
is checking in on him every day, eh?
Yeah, from what I can see, she is worn Shinji down.
Sakura's a tenacious girl,
so he is been browbeaten into letting her look after him.
That is wonderful news.
Just the two kids I was looking for!
It is been a month since anyone's heard from him,
and at the start of the new semester, a new teacher will be coming.
We will look after Kuzuki-sensei's personal effects at the temple.
He turned up at the temple out of nowhere in the first place,
so I suppose it is fitting that he left us the same way.
Well, if it is not the student council president.
Patrolling campus so early in the morning?
Or are you making maintenance rounds of the club rooms?
Tohsaka!
I tire of saying it so often,
but you really are diligent that way, are not you?
I have grown rather tired of our rote exchanges, myself!
Why not chance a different guess every once in a while?
Surely you have not been deliberately repeating yourself, Tohsaka!
Of course I have.
What?
You never figured that out?
Ryuudou-kun sure is uptight,
do not you think?
Wh-What is the meaning of this, Emiya?!
What manner of relationship are you in with this foul vixen?!
Uh, I...
Anyway, come get me in my classroom later, Emiya-kun.
I will wait until you get there.
Wh-What in the world?
Oh!
There you are, president!
Mitsuzuri Ayako...
President, would you mind explaining that budget?
Why is my club's budget the one to get slashed?
The archery club is not the only one!
All club budgets have had to be reviewed.
I do not buy it!
You will stand right there and explain yourself!
Say, Emiya-kun...
Were you ever in the track club?
Track club?
No, I was always in the archery club.
Oh...
Well, I guess these things happen.
When I was looking at the sunset, some memories came back.
You have to admit, it is flown by in a flash...
It is been a month since the Holy Grail War ended and you signed on as my pupil.
At this rate, the next year will fly by.
After that happens, we will be leaving this school behind.
What do you plan to do after graduation?
Follow in your father's footsteps?
Uh, yeah...
Why?
After I graduate, I am going to London.
After all that is happened, the Mages Association gave me a letter of recommendation.
London?
The Mages Association's headquarters?
That Clock Tower place?
I have been invited as the Tohsaka family heir.
They say I can bring a pupil with me if I like.
Um, does that mean...
So.
What will you be doing?
Damn it, you always go right for my weak spot.
What?
Look...
This is important, so give me a straight answer.
Will you come with me?
Do not ask when you already know the answer.
Then let us continue to have a productive relationship, Emiya-kun!
I am going to whip you into shape until you are a proper mage, so brace yourself!
My life's goal is to make you into a new man,
one who is thoroughly happy.
Thanks for bringing me with you.
Excuse me.
You are the exchange student from Japan?
Actually, that would be Tohsaka.
I know that.
I was referring to you.
You are from Fuyuki City, in Japan, right?
You do not seem to have the makings of a mage.
I imagine you were an outsider who was
caught up in the ritual and missed his chance to get out?
I find it puzzling.
After surviving that troublesome war,
to what end have you come to Clock Tower?
To what end do you study magic?
Good question.
Since coming here, I have learned many things,
and in many ways, I have been out of my depth.
But I want to keep believing in what I believed in before.
I want to dedicate my life to that.
Meaning what, exactly?
Well, I realize how dumb this sounds...
But I want to become something.
A hero of justice.
I see.
That certainly is idiotic.
But it is not humorous.
A hero of justice, you say?
This place is, indeed, a small world.
Tohsaka?
Did we have plans for dinner?
I was waiting for you.
Well?
What did you do about enrollment?
Oh, I turned them down.
You are not angry?
I knew this would happen.
Oh, but if you are not going to join Clock Tower,
I guess that means I will be thrown out in three years, too.
No, that does not mean you have to
Are you sure, though?
I have been thinking about it nonstop,
but I do not think I will ever be able to change how I live.
Even when I know I am not right, I cannot change paths.
It is just as he said...
I will meet the same fate.
He is right.
I agree with him there.
You are full of mistakes, Shirou.
You are probably on the same path, heading in the same direction.
The difference might be in how far you can go.
What matters is where you end up, and how far you came, right?
Even if your destination and the result end up being the same,
if you manage to walk a little further afterward,
I know you will get your proper ending.
I see.
I really hope it turns out like that.
No, I guess I will have to ensure that that is what happens.
I would not worry.
I mean, you have had your answer all along.
But are you really sure?
Clock
Tower is an important place to you, right?
I will be fine.
In the end, I will probably settle down at Clock Tower.
But I want to look around and get stuff out of my system.
You know, see the world.
So now it is my turn to drag you around with me, huh?
Yeah, though that is all a ways off yet.
Regardless, having fun, suffering, seeing the sights,
and eventually having our own happily ever after.
That is the future in store for us.
A boy once said,
I do not want to watch people die.
If people can be saved,
could it be possible to save every person that is suffering?
What the boy was trying to cut down was himself.
He wielded his sword for what he came to believe in.
There is no longer a path where his battle ends and he turns back.
However, he did get his answer.
He has regrets.
And he does not know how many times he has wished to do it all over.
This fate is set in stone,
and Emiya will probably go on cursing it.
But even still,
I was not wrong.
